THE CRACK HAS BEEN MADE!

MACK69AC2CRACK

Instructions:

1) The crack is fairly simple. You just need a macbook that fits the requirements, and a BRAIN

2) Go to skidrows manual crack 

3) do what he says with the host file, except do it on your mac. you can find out how to do this easily if you search google ;)

4) run the necessary commands, and just do the mac equivalent of the windows commands

then run the game

5)???

6) PROFIT!

Nah, im joking about 5 and 6 lol, but the fifth step is to play the game. Umm the first thing i can say about the game is that it will give you some hiccups at first, such as a freezeup here and there, so it is reccomended that you not use any applications in the background while playing the game. other than that, it is a well made game. if this doesn't work for you, just use bootcamp and download AC2 + the windows crack and play it there.

your welcome in advance!

*As proof, there is a video on youtube of a guy playing AC2 on his iMac. I have been in correspondence with him about this method, which is also what he used to play AC2 on his mac. However, he was spanish so he couldn't really tell people how to get it. Im english so...i posted it. Later!

Also, there is a bug where the game may crash unexpectedly. however, ac2 usually has autosaved before this has happened most of the time, so i never really lost progress. in not sure what the exact issue is, but i suspect that it is a permissions issue. anyway, ill post the fix as i find out.

Lol, forgot to add: 

you gotta do the cmd commands in terminal, and in mac commands. I'll show you how \/

to run the python file, write the following

python /Users/yourname/whereeverYouSavedIt/tls.py

to edit the hosts file, open terminal and write: sudo nano /private/etc/hosts

then add the lines in the bottom.

click ctrl+o to save it, then ctrl+x to exit.

on step 16, to browse it, write cd /users/yourname/

and whereever you saved it.

nd3s, do this:

1. open terminal

2. write in: sudo nano /private/etc/hosts

3. write in your password

4. write in this in the last line:

127.0.0.1       static3.cdn.ubi.com
127.0.0.1       ubisoft-orbit.s3.amazonaws.com
127.0.0.1       onlineconfigservice.ubi.com
127.0.0.1       orbitservice.ubi.com
127.0.0.1       ubisoft-orbit-savegames.s3.amazonaws.com

5. save the file

6. exit the terminal

7. open 03_run_server

8. play assassins creed 2'

9. enjoy the game

Okay, to the guys who cant save, this is what i did: 

1. create a new account on your mac

2. put ac2 and offlineserv.zip in shared folder

3. login to the new account

4. uninstall ac2

5. install ac2

6. run 01_add_hosts

7. run 03_add_server

8. run assasssins creed 2

9. click the gearwheel and press ok

10. play

11. exit game

12. play your saved game

Thank you for the torrent btw.

@everyone: To reduce the lag, basically, you must have the strong processor (core +2 duo +2.6GHz) and high video RAM (+512MB). Now i recommend some more things for guys who just only have computers which have low or medium configuration, and laptop (it's maybe riddiculous but it's fine for me! :) )
- Keep you computer as cool as possible (when you run the game, your PC will be very hot, and so, as time pass by, the PC will be slower and slower. So use some methods of cool down)
- For the laptop (in here i say macbook): Keep your fan run as strong as possible. In my macbook pro, first, the game run very lag and slow. But when my fan run stronger, strangely, it run smoother and faster (although it still get some lag but it's acceptable).
*The test here is done on the lowest settings. I recommend to do so!!!

@everyone
i think i know the solution for that problem when you look at the apple of eden and the video stops. It is the same solution which helped when saves where gone. You just uninstall the game, and install it again. But before that you have to do this: go to the games contents/Resources and than there is this folder called Storage, save it to your desktop, and than there is this file called orbitdll_savegame_log_aGVucmlrYXM= ,save it too. After reinstalling your game, go to contents/resources and you will see that there is no storage folder, folder called SAVES and that "orbit" file. Create SAVES folder (i dont realy know that this is necessary because it's allways empty) and than copy storage folder and "orbit file" to recources folder. Thats it. Video didn't stoped for me after this. Enjoy!

I downloaded this torrent (and the crack) and tried to play the game. I soon found that it is a very good game, but it's one of those games for which it is strongly advisable to use a controller. This Mac version, whether downloaded here or bought in the shops, does not provide controller compatibility. I have long had an Xbox 360 wireless controller for Windows games I used to play, and I also have a PS3 controller for my PS3. I bought and downloaded ControllerMate, a very good app that enables you to configure controllers for use in games on the Mac, but even with this app, controllers won't work on AC2. I have now bought a pre-owned AC2 for the PS3 for Â£14.99 ($23.98). I strongly recommend that you save time downloading this torrent by getting this game for a different platform that will allow you to play it with a controller. Nevertheless, thank you to Apokarteron for making this torrent available, because I wouldn't have known that the game was worth paying for had I not tried it here first.

Ok I'm running MBP late 2011 10.7.2 with 4 gigs ram AMD radeon hd 6770m 1gb vram and 2.4ghz i7... everything works great. well, not really... 

PROS: 
1: It works. 
2: I didn't have to pay for it. 
3: It's a great game. 

CONS: 
1: THE RESOLUTION is SHIT. I can't find out how to change it. Don't take me the wrong way, it's definitely playable, but for what my mac can do, I want more. I like a nice looking game, but I'm not too OCD about so I can live with that.
2: For some reason, I can't get it to run in windowed mode, and I can't alt-tab out of it. So once I start playing, the ONLY way to do something else like change my music or check emails, or w/e is to quit the game, which is incredibly annoying since I like to flick in and out of apps. But hey, I didn't pay for it, so I'm not complaining, it's just a shame. 

Anybody have any ideas? If anyone can help with my resolution and app switching problems, PLEASE email me: sng98@live.com
